# NSPlaceholders

A set of methods that an object can implement to register default placeholders to be displayed for a binding, when no other placeholder is specified.

## Overview

Individual placeholder values can be specified for each of the marker objects (described in [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/selection-markers]), as well as when the property is `nil`.

Placeholders are used when a property of an instance of the receiving class is accessed through a key value coding compliant method, and returns `nil` or a specialized marker.

## Managing default placeholders

- **setDefaultPlaceholder(_:for:with:)**: Sets `placeholder` as the default placeholder for the `binding`, when a key value coding compliant property of an instance of the receiving class returns the value specified by `marker`, and no other placeholder has been specified.
- **defaultPlaceholder(for:with:)**: Returns an object that will be used as the placeholder for the `binding`, when a key value coding compliant property of an instance of the receiving class returns the value specified by `marker`, and no other placeholder has been specified.

## Constants

- **Selection Markers**: The following constants are used to describe special cases for a controller’s selection.

## Data Placeholders

- **NSBindingSelectionMarker**
